name: The Color-Coded Underground: Prototype
description:
A doom-inspired roguelite that is focused on color coordinated crits and augmentations.

Download at the bottom of the page!

Welcome to the Unnamed Doomlike prototype!

Don't wanna read through all this crap? Don't worry! It's included in the prototype as a readme for reference.

A few quick things before starting:

1: This is a prototype. Function over polish is the name of the game.

2: As this is a prototype, it is very unfinished. So if possible, I hope you'll be able to provide feedback on the most basic of things;  be they obvious or otherwise.

3: This is a short gameplay prototype for the base game

3: There are many features that don't have a proper UI and as such, are finicky to work with. These are listed here.

NOTE:
Currently, there is no way to change settings in game. But there is an config ini in the appdata folder. It's created after loading the game for the first time.
If for whatever reason, something is not loading correctly, delete the config ini and/or save file and reload. Otherwise, report it as a bug.

The UI:
The user interface is easily the roughest part of this prototype. As such, there is still some debug information listed there.
Currently, health, points, level goal, world, level, seed, and the gun wheel are present in text form.
The level goal tells you what you need to do to continue to the next level.

Gun wheel:
This lists the guns currently in your possession. As of right now, you can only have one of each color weapon for a total of three guns in your wheel. This approach may or may not be changed later on.

Color Coordinated Criticals:
These are relatively self explanatory, but still pretty rough in execution. Here's the basics of how they're implemented.
Red guns (shotgun, spur) are effective against red enemies.
Greed guns (rifle, pistol) are effective against green enemies.
Blue weapons (bat, homing shotgun) are neutral to all enemies.
IMPORTANT NOTE: I realize those who are color blind will have difficulty with this. I am open to suggestions for later phases of development to attempt to solve this issue. The current plan is to use distinct sounds in addition to color.

Criticals are signaled by a high pitched ding sound (it varies slightly to avoid repetition).
Neutral hits are signaled similarly, but will be a consistent lower pitched.
Less-than-effective hits are signaled by a rough smack sound.

Safe Rooms:
After so many rooms, you will spawn in a "safe rooms" here, you can buy augmentations or save.
There are currently two sections of these rooms. A "story hall" and a "vendor hall" the story hall is self explanatory, but the vendor hall is used for saving and augmentations.
To use either, approach them, and a makeshift menu will appear.

Augmentations:
These are currently very rough in implementation as well.
Approach the vendor, and three selections will appear: body, legs, and arms.
Body augmentations will often be mostly stat related, such as health or bullets. 
Leg augmentations will be movement related.
Arm augmentations are more unique in their effects, such as increased knockback, as well as knocking the player back as well.

You will need to kill 10 points (red orbs) to buy a single augmentation and only one of each augmentation can be equipped.

QuickSaving:
A very basic saving system is implemented at the "bar" where you approach, and a "[save?]" prompt will appear. When clicked, a save file will appear in the appdata folder and the game will close.
Upon reloading, you will spawn back in the safe room with all previous stats, augmentations, and weapons.

Bugs & Suggestions:
For information on reporting bugs and any suggestions you may have, check the pinned discussion topic.
